definition: to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: He prayed for his friends and turned things around, enjoyed happiness after long suffering.
sentences.chinese: 为朋友祈祷，成为转捩点，苦尽甘来。

sentences.english: In what ways was the coming of Perry a turning point in late Tokugawa history?
sentences.chinese: 培理叩关在哪些方面是德川幕府晚期历史的转捩点？

sentences.english: Yi Teng, Have let my life have turning point.
sentences.chinese: 亿婷，让我的人生有了转捩点。

sentences.english: When did the turning points occur in this story?
sentences.chinese: 事情的转捩点在什么时候？

sentences.english: The turnaround began with two little-noted events in 2003.
sentences.chinese: 转捩点是发生在2003的两件不甚受瞩目的事件。

sentences.english: Hong Kong is now at the watershed between stability and unrest. The central government cannot be too wary of that.
sentences.chinese: 香港现正处于安危治乱的转捩点，中央对此不能不察。

sentences.english: Here we see the turning point investigated by analytic discourse.
sentences.chinese: 在此我们看到由精神分析论述研究的这个转捩点。

sentences.english: With the increase of attack angle, the transiton point moves from the frailing edge to leading edge.
sentences.chinese: 随攻角的增大，转捩点从后沿移向前沿。

definition: turbulent situation/changing (face, scene, situation, world of etc)
(Tw) to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
see 承前啟後|承前启后[cheng2 qian2 qi3 hou4]
the situation (e.g. political)/the state of the world
to take a broad view of sth
benchmark/pole serving as mark or symbol/pole with a trophy hung on it
